Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.bigbasin_bmc_stress.bmc_stress

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase

'''
This script is to validate Leopard/Expander box BMC/IPMI access.

IPMI commands issued inband or oob (w.r.t Leopard and jbog).

Each stress cycle performs-
- Host power on
- Execute inband and oob ipmi commands
- Host power off
- Execute oob ipmi commands

After the completion of all the cycles, Power on the host, if the host is in OFF state

IPMI commands executed are listed in json file

'''



[docs]class BmcStress(TestBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(BmcStress, self).__init__()
        self.log_info("control file is %s" % self.test_control)
        self.dev_type = self.test_control['dev_type']
        self.cycle_count = self.test_control['cycle_count']
        self.commands = self.test_control['commands']



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info(" BMC Stress Test")

        out = self.host.oob.check_powered_on()
        if not out:
            out = self.host.oob.power_on()
            self.validate_condition(True, " Host powered ON state")

        self.host.oob.run_ipmicmd("sel clear")

        for n in range(0, self.cycle_count):
            self.validate_condition(True, " Cycle %d - Started" % (n + 1))

            self.log_info(
                " Host power in ON state - Running both inb and oob ipmi cmds"
            )
            self.inband_ipmi_cmds(self.dev_type, self.commands)
            self.oob_ipmi_cmds(self.dev_type, self.commands)
            out = self.host.oob.power_off()
            self.log_info(
                " Host power in OFF state - Running only oob ipmi commands"
            )
            self.oob_ipmi_cmds(self.dev_type, self.commands)
            out = self.host.oob.power_on()
            self.log_info("Host is powered ON")
            self.validate_condition(True, "Cycle %d - Completed" % (n + 1))



[docs]    def inband_ipmi_cmds(self, dev_type, commands):
        cmd_list = self.commands
        for value in range(0, len(cmd_list)):
            if (self.dev_type == "Leopard"):
                cmd = (cmd_list[value])
            elif (self.dev_type == "jbog"):
                self.log_info("Bridged ipmi command")
                cmd = ("-b 9 -t 0x2c %s" % cmd_list[value])
            else:
                self.validate_condition(
                    False, "Device type %s not supported" % (dev_type)
                )
            self.log_info("Running inband ipmi command: %s" % cmd)
            out = self.host.inband.run_ipmicmd(cmd)
            self.log_info(out)



[docs]    def oob_ipmi_cmds(self, dev_type, commands):
        cmd_list = self.commands
        for value in range(0, len(cmd_list)):
            if (self.dev_type == "Leopard"):
                cmd = (cmd_list[value])
            elif (self.dev_type == "jbog"):
                self.log_info("Bridged ipmi command")
                cmd = ("-b 9 -t 0x2c %s" % cmd_list[value])
            else:
                self.validate_condition(
                    False, "Device type %s not supported" % (dev_type)
                )
            self.log_info("Running oob ipmi command: %s" % cmd)
            out = self.host.oob.run_ipmicmd(cmd)
            self.log_info(out)




[docs]def main():
    test = BmcStress()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
